description: Borrowed from French glacier, from Franco-Provençal glacier, derived from glace + -ier, (cf. also Medieval Latin glaciarium), derived from Vulgar Latin *glacia, from Latin glacies (“ice”), from Proto-Indo-European *gel- (“to be cold, to freeze”).

entries.meaning: (geology) A large body of ice which flows under its own mass, usually downhill.
examples: They warned that the effects of glacier melting on water resources are becoming “increasingly serious” for China.
